thread.title: Waze Sued for Allegedly Stealing Map Data
thread.title_full: Waze Sued for Allegedly Stealing Map Data

title: Waze Sued for Allegedly Stealing Map Data
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
4 Sep 2015 02:02 AM EST 
Google and its mapping service Waze are being dragged to court over allegations that Waze stole data from a rival's map database. The lawsuit was filed in San Francisco federal court on Tuesday by PhantomAlert. The company alleges that the navigation app used proprietary data from PhantomAlert without permission. Both apps share road, red light and traffic information. According to PhantomAlert CEO Joseph Seyoum, he noticed that Waze was using the same fictitious location information in its app that his company had used for testing.
